name: Sidorenko's conjecture
rephrased: For any bipartite graph H, the number of copies of H as a subgraph in a large graph G with n vertices and average degree pn is asymptotically at least (pn)^{|V(H)|} (where |V(H)| is the number of vertices in H).
implication_form: If G is a graph on n vertices with average degree pn, then the number of homomorphisms from H to G is asymptotically at least (pn)^{|V(H)|}.
